message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.SD 

The paper focuses on the design and feasibility of an Android TV application for older adults to participate in online crowdsourcing tasks. The study involves assessing the older adults' interaction and engagement with the TV-enabled online crowdsourcing task, which falls under the category of Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC). The application uses Amara API to retrieve subtitles for TEDx talks, which involves natural language processing (cs.CL) and cybersecurity (cs.CY) considerations. The study also addresses physical and cognitive comfort, which falls under the category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) and Sustainable Development (cs.SD).
